title: Unexpected truncated boolean when debug printing with limited float precision.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code
```rust

fn main() {                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
    println!("Hello, world! {:.3?}", false);                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
} 
```
Actual output
```
Hello, world! fal
```

Expected output, because a boolean isn't a decimal....
```
Hello, world! false
```

Version stuff:
```
$ rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 73528e339aae0f17a15ffa49a8ac608f50c6cf14
commit-date: 2019-12-16
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.40.0
LLVM version: 9.0
```
